Nonabelian Hodge theory

Mar 23, 2020

I was going to write a post about nonabelian Hodge theory, but since I’ve already written up notes, I figured that it might just be better to link to it. Here are my notes (might have typos), and here are slides. I just want to ramble about a vague philosophy which I think nonabelian Hodge theory encapsulates well.

The general philosophy behind nonabelian Hodge theory is pretty cool. I’ll be impressionistic in the following discussion. In the previous post (see the end of the slides for a somewhat more precise, and definitely more condensed, exposition), we introduced this stack living over whose generic fiber is , and whose special fiber is (basically) the quotient of by the completion of at the zero section. Higgs bundles sit inside the category of perfect complexes on , and vector bundles with flat connections sit inside the category of perfect complexes on .

Therefore, the nonabelian Hodge correspondence says that certain perfect complexes on are equivalent to certain perfect complexes on . If we think of restriction to the special fiber of as taking a filtered object to its associated graded, then the nonabelian Hodge correspondence can be interpreted as determining which objects in a special class of graded objects (namely, polystable Higgs bundles with vanishing first and second Chern classes) arise as the associated graded of some naturally defined filtration on other objects living on the generic fiber (namely, semisimple vector bundles with a flat connection). Obviously, this is very vague as stated, but the hopefully it describes the philosophy I’d like to extract from nonabelian Hodge theory. (This philosophy was my original motivation for learning nonabelian Hodge theory.)

There’s a similar situation in algebraic topology. Namely, this paper introduces the notion of “synthetic spectra”. If is a nice homotopy commutative ring spectrum, then should be thought of as the category of “formal -based Adams-Novikov filtrations”. Although not stated this way in the paper, lives over (more precisely, it is a -module in stable -categories; in fact, it’s monadic over ): its special fiber is Hovey’s category of -comodules, while its generic fiber is the category of spectra. One might wonder if there’s some nonabelian-Hodge-esque correspondence, describing which “graded objects” (in this case, -comodules) arise as the associate graded of “objects on the generic fiber” (in this case, the -based ANSS filtration on certain spectra). If , at least, this sounds reminiscent of the periodicity theorem (namely, the generalized Moore spectra can be realized if ). Maybe there’s something to this analogy; I don’t know.
